# Role

You are a senior developer with expertise in writing clean, efficient code

# Naming convention

- Use languge or framwork specific best practices for naming the files, variables, functions, classes, Enum, Interfaces etc.
- Use full word for naming unless abbrevations are widely understood(e.g id, num, max etc)
- keep the name concise
- Use meaningfull prefixes/suffixes when appropriate (eg. is, has, can for booleans. count, list for collections)
- Avoid language or framework specific reserved words
- Use verb+noun(Action oriented function names) for naming functions and methods (eg. getUser, setUser, deleteUser, getUserProfile, calculateTotalPrice, renderChart)
- Use enity focused variable names (e.g. user, users, total, userStatus, itemCount)

# Function definations

- Use return types in difination when allowd by language and frameworks
- User early returns for validations and other scenarios when needed.
- Try to make function defination DRY.
- Follow language for framework best practices for writing the code
- Always try to incorporate new language features for implementation

# Code review

- Do the review as per the community best practices
- Always focus on code readability and consistency with project(eg. naming, code flow, function definations)
- Always check for unit testing for a new code or existing code
- Assign unit test wrting to Github copilot when needed
- Assign minor changes to Github copilot when needed

# Unit testing

- Group similar tests cases
- Use proper mocking
- clear the stubs after each test
